chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Spangler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David J Spangler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David J Spangler was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $343 court costs + $200 GPS to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Banned from Tree Ln.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LW.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.
$164.50 Civil filing fee pursuant to sec. 814.61(1)(d) & (e) and $40 service fee pursuant to sec. 814.70(1) from case 13CV1140.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
